metadata.title: CVE-2019-17023 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
After a HelloRetryRequest has been sent, the client may negotiate a lowerprotocol that TLS 1.3, resulting in an invalid state transition in the TLSState Machine. If the client gets into this state, incoming ApplicationData records will be ignored. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 72.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
